alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 9:21PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Rutland and northwestern Windsor Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 920 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rutland, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rutland, Woodstock, Barnard, Killington, Shrewsbury, Rutland City, Wallingford, Stockbridge, Proctor, Rutland - Southern Vermont Airport, Pomfret, Bridgewater, Mendon, Pittsfield, Clarendon, West Rutland, Ira, Chittenden, Plymouth, and Bethel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
